metadata.title: CVE-2017-9434 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Crypto++ (aka cryptopp) through 5.6.5 contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in zinflate.cpp in the Inflator filter. It was discovered that Crypto++ mishandled certain input. An attacker could use this vulnerability to leak potentially sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-9434` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcrypto++-utils - 5.6.4-8
libcrypto++8 - 5.6.4-8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcrypto++ package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.4-8').
